reviews.review: Like it!

[h1] As of August 25th, Marc Laidlaw, writer of the Half-Life canon story has released a letter piece that has made a mark on gaming history forever. [/h1]

On a blog post from completely out of nowhere, Laidlaw, the brains behind arguably the greatest narrative driven FPS game of all time, released on his blog the final puzzle piece to the great mystery of the mythological Half-Life 3. A letter for the fans to finally settle the 10 year mental prison of confusion all gamers have undergone.

Unfortunately I cannot place the entire letter here as Steam has a certain word limit for reviews (and believe me it is a pretty lengthy letter). Instead what I'll do is place the last paragraph of both versions of the letter here, the first original one with encrypted wording from Marc himself from his blog and the edited version with the names of the characters we all know and love edited by Jackathan on GitHub

The least I can do as a Half-Life fan and dedicated member of the community is post something here. I deserve no credit for this what so ever.



The link to his blog is right [url=http://www.marclaidlaw.com/epistle-3/] here [/url]. currently at the moment his blog is overflooded with traffic which goes to show how big these news are

[url=https://github.com/Jackathan/MarcLaidlaw-Epistle3/] Here [/url] is the GitHub link as well



For all new members of the franchise, view at your own risk as this is one of the greatest narratives ever told in gaming. For everyone else, enjoy.

[h1] Epistle 3 (Marc Laidlaw's original version) [/h1]

[spoiler] And here we are. I spoke of my return to this shore. It has been a circuitous path to lands I once knew, and surprising to see how much the terrain has changed. Enough time has passed that few remember me, or what I was saying when last I spoke, or what precisely we hoped to accomplish. At this point, the resistance will have failed or succeeded, no thanks to me. Old friends have been silenced, or fallen by the wayside. I no longer know or recognize most members of the research team, though I believe the spirit of rebellion still persists. I expect you know better than I the appropriate course of action, and I leave you to it. Except no further correspondence from me regarding these matters; this is my final epistle.

Yours in infinite finality,

Gertrude Fremont, Ph.D. [/spoiler]


[h1] Episode 3 (Jackathan's edited version) [/h1]

[spoiler] And here we are. I spoke of my return to this shore. It has been a circuitous path to lands I once knew, and surprising to see how much the terrain has changed. Enough time has passed that few remember me, or what I was saying when last I spoke, or what precisely we hoped to accomplish. At this point, the resistance will have failed or succeeded, no thanks to me. Old friends have been silenced, or fallen by the wayside. I no longer know or recognize most members of the research team, though I believe the spirit of rebellion still persists. I expect you know better than I the appropriate course of action, and I leave you to it. Expect no further correspondence from me regarding these matters; this is my final episode.

Yours in infinite finality,

Gordon Freeman, Ph.D. [spoiler]

哎，有些可惜，半条命2是初中玩的，如今快上大学了突然想起来这经典游戏，但是玩到第二季才发现中文配音没有了！半条命2的中文配音真的是很良心，人物的语气拿捏得很到位，有代入感。         希望有生之年能看到半条命3的发售吧，真的2004年半条命2绝对是惊艳了整个游戏界。现在的游戏各个游戏大厂画面都做得都不差，也许半条命3的画面不再是鹤立鸡群，但能见到戈登，能再拿起撬棍，画质什么的都不重要。也许半条命3发售的那一天会流下眼泪，那是一段青春岁月的见证。
ААААААААААА Буря имоций игра просто ваааааааааааа концовка грустная( но в целом игра стоит своих денег очень залипательная)
这款游戏相信是很多人年轻甚至是儿童时候的记忆，那时候还是买的光碟，现在真正在steam上购买到正版并进行游玩，有一种别样的心情。剧情，画面，体感，一如既往的好。并没有令我失望。是一款很值得入手的游戏。也是一款很经典的游戏。

Классная игра. Если у кого то не запускается игра (Вылетает, черный экран и т.д.) включите DEP для всех EXE-файлов. Мне помогло это. 
Чтоб включить, зайдите в система->"Изменить параметры" или "Дополнительные параметры системы"->
"Дополнительно"->Быстродействие->"Предотвращение выполнения данных" и ставьте галочку на "Включить DEP для всех программ и служб, кроме выбранных ниже.

Half-Life 2: Episode Two é, de longe, um dos melhores "Half-Life's'' que eu joguei, sendo uma ótima continuação do Half-Life 2: Episode One. Os gráficos são os que todos já conhecem, aqueles da engine Source.
   Por mim, o ponto forte do jogo são os novos inimigos que aparecem, como os Hunters ou os Advisor, mesmo que este já tenha aparecido no Episode One, além de adicionar um carro que saiu da loteria.

   O jogo tem muitos pontos fortes e poucos pontos fracos, e pede por uma continuação de Half-Life 3, o que acho que nunca veremos.

 PS: Se ainda não jogastes esta Obra-Prima, recomendo-ti fortemente.

A finalização com maestria de uma verdadeira obra prima dos games!

In the first 2 minutes of this game, Alyx was more helpful than she was in all of HL2:EP1 by using the gravity gun to open the train door. And then not long after that, she's unconcious throughout a good half of the game. Already things are looking good! The first third of this game involves a lot of puzzle solving which I enjoyed because they were fairly clever and didn't feel like they were just placed in random spots, and I didn't have Alyx telling me things like "Hey, I think that wire goes somewhere" or "Hey, I think a crank needs to go here" etc. The only part I didn't care for was the last 10 minutes where I have to destroy like 10 Striders with those weird exploding spheres. That was just tedious. But that aside, this brought on some new characters/concepts/plotlines, most of which were handled pretty well.

Another excellent addition to the Half-Life 2 series. I got double the hours from Episode 2 over Episode 1, largely due to the harder achievements. "Get some grub," "Little Rocket Man," and "Neighborhood Watch" are quite difficult and will likely require a guide. Worth putting the time in. For .79, ten hours of zombine, antlion, grub killin fun, 22 more achievements and another perfect game. Would do again.

Игра Half-Life 2:Episode Two – продолжение первой сюжетной линии Episode One. Главная особенность второго эпизода — большие открытые пространства; лесная местность даёт игроку свободно путешествовать на новом автомобиле, а геймплей становится менее линейным: согласно задумке, с разнообразной тактикой ведения боя каждая битва будет непохожа на предыдущую. Кроме лесных территорий, игрок пройдёт заброшенные шахты, гнездо муравьиных львов и ракетную базу — все эти локации так же будут отличаться своей масштабностью. Во втором эпизоде нет такого сосредоточения на кооперативной игре, как в первом: хотя сюжетно игрок проходит всю игру вместе со своей напарницей Аликс Вэнс, во многих игровых событиях она по тем или иным причинам не принимает участия. Кроме Аликс, игроку предстоит сражаться бок о бок с дружественными вортигонтами. Сюжет эпизода начинается там, где заканчивается Episode One. После взрыва Цитадели поезд, на котором уезжали Гордон Фримен и Алик Вэнс, попадает под взрывную волну и терпит крушение. Им приходится добираться до главной базы Сопротивления — комплекса «Белая Роща» — своими силами. Главная цель — доставить в Белую Рощу данные, добытые в Цитадели, где содержатся секретные планы руководства Альянса, а также код частоты сверхпортала, образовавшегося над разрушенным Сити 17. Этот портал должен вновь прочно связать Землю и вселенную Альянса, что грозит человечеству приходом подкрепления инопланетных захватчиков и повторением Семичасовой войны. Однако, используя код частоты волны портала, у повстанцев есть возможность закрыть его при помощи ракеты со спутником, на котором установлен «зен-резонатор», запустив его из Белой Рощи. Но все усугубляется тем, что разведка Альянса обнаружила базу и туда уже направляется ударная армия. Фримен и Аликс вынуждены поторопиться, чтобы успеть доставить данные и предупредить повстанцев о надвигающейся угрозе.

Just replayed for the 5th-ish time I think?

3 things about this game:

1) While Valve broadened their scope by making the game a little more non-linear (really just via the driving section and the finale boss fight), I think it's rather over-linearized in terms of how it plays out, moreso than other HL games. While playing this game the first time I often felt like there is only EXACTLY one very convenient solution to every problem (I get the feeling that this is played off as part of the G-Man's existence but that honestly feels like a cop-out). The gun level/ aka crouching yard full of zombies is a great example of how the EXACT PATH you must take is perfectly laid out even though it's supposed to be a "messy" place, from the exact path of starting to the grenade dropping finish. Other Valve games have similar features, but I definitely felt that this one was the most tightly "scripted." 

To that end, completing the game feels like an easy, easy task.

2) That being said, it is the most refined, exciting and refreshing game I've ever played. It's so well done. The gameplay is as fun as anything I've ever played...and the sections are broken up so much more nicely than Half Life 2 (I love HL2 but it's repetitive compared to EP1 and EP2). 

If uber-scripted moments are the tradeoff for this masterpiece of a game - I more than gladly accept. But I would love more obfuscating of what's actually occuring in-game to get me to my solution.

3) Valve not releasing Half Life 3 (or whatever) is a travesty. I just hope that there are people working on it somewhere!?

Unlike the Episode One, this part is bugless and the length is longer too. I'd definitely recommend it to HL fans. The last chapter [spoiler](silo defense from striders)[/spoiler] is pretty hardcore: having completed HL, HL2 and HL2 Ep1 on Hard I had to switch to Easy for this chapter simply because the lack of time [spoiler](attacks are too frequent to fight them off on time)[/spoiler], unless you are a pro-gamer, which I am not. Liked and advised!

I already mentioned in my previous reviews that I didn't like Half Life 2, but enjoyed Half-Life 2: Episode One. Episode Two, however, I think is a great game. This one, unlike the previous Half Life 2 games, is extremely fun to play with full of breathtaking moments. It is also the only one I totally enjoyed shooting -especially at the striders in the final chapter-. The story also seems to be more focused. At the end, I would not consider myself a Half Life fan but it was a blast to play this final entry to the series. 

[b]9/10[/b]

A great end to a great series

La suite directe des évènements d'HL2E1, mais cette fois-ci, Valve a mis le paquet. Vous arrivez à vous échapper de Cité 17, mais la menace Combine est toujours là, le pire reste à venir...

Le gameplay est toujours plaisant, ça reste dans la continuité de la série. Cet épisode est bien mieux rythmé que HL2 lui-même, à mon humble avis. La durée de vie est d'environ 6h.

Comme toujours, les musiques sont excellentes et sont agréables à écouter.

Comme pour l'épisode 1, nous avons droit à quelques améliorations du moteur Source, peu visibles néanmoins.

Le cliffhanger à la fin de cet épisode nous promet une suite géniale qui devrait conclure la série de manière magistrale. Malheureusement, et pour des raisons inconnues, nous attendons toujours cette suite depuis bientôt 10 ans déjà.

Bref, cet épisode est une montagne russe d'émotions, principalement dû au scénario. Evidemment, je le recommande à tous ceux qui aiment Half-Life, et qui souhaiteraient en apprendre encore plus sur l'univers.

밸브는 3를 내놔라

THiS REVIEW , comes from a person who holds no alliegance to Gabe, only played bits of HL2 before this last week, and in general FPS are not my favorite game types and I hate games that have zombies or horde type monsters. I love Steam because of Steam Link, controller and Steam plataform but not because of portal TF or half life ( i do like Portal 2 but i got stuck and never finished ) 

I wanted to say that because there is probably more than a million reviews and I come from a different background. Many say this was their childhood ( mine was metal gear, final fantasy, tekken and bascially playstation and early nintendo ) and in PC ( star craft, deus ex ), wanted to make my review more of observations than just saying pros and cons ect. 

1. Half Life is hard, compared to modern FPS, I played in easy and it was comparable to med\hard in newer FPS. 
2. The game wants very badly to sell yo it's fisics, it's almost like a really long gravity gun demo. ( I like the gun and it's uses are innovative but sometiemes felt forced, like they are saying " you could use guns I guess,,, but HERES A BIG BARREL OF GASOLINE with the gravity gun you'll make a big BOOM! " )
3. some of the weapons like tha basic pistol/shotgun and SMG are really uninspired and look like the were checking boxes in order to comply with FPS standards, ( I love the shotgun but it's just a very plan and boring looking shotgun ) 
4. The graphics don't age, I mean eventually they will age but overall the game is fine and good looking, it's amazing what some good fasescans and good art design can do, newer games should take notice ( or bethesda with their oldish models in their open world games ). some of the guns are the exception but overall everything is amazing. 
5. voice acting can be taken for granted but people should remember back when this game came out voice acting wasn't done by big hollywood actors, Voice acting was done and worked but considering the time I think the voice acting here is pretty amazing. considiering is not a new game even secondary actors sound really good. 
6. The level designs are ingenious, what makes them good is that they feel authentic you never feel like you are going just point A to point B they use great design and variaty of enemies and obstacles to make you feel like walking through a warehousue is interesting.  
7. zombie variety is good, am not a fan of Zombies, but if I were i'd have to say the whole concepts of crabs detaching and sometiems attacking or just randomly walkig about  or crab tossing hosts makes for interesting and very dynamic zombie fighting. 
8. Alyx Vance is a solid hero, making her important in EP 1 and 2 was smart, I think she was ahead of her time a little bit, most heroine are not like her, she is not over sexualised, she is shown to be braved and not a damsel in distress and she is excellently voiced. 
9. The non speaking hero concept is old school so I don't hold it against the game but I belevie a talking Freeman would be better, because he is a scientist part of the concept of playing a high IQ character would be to have him talk give ideas or be a leader, he really just feels like a marine character following orders. 
10. I really like the no bosses concept of the game, it means they try harder to make the obstacles be the bosses not one specific character. 
11. G man is a daring character, and it's fourth wall breaking style gives the games story layer. BUT I hate ambiguity having a character just show up and say somewhat cryptic things and not really there  being anything else about him is strange.
12. My original observation of this game without playing too far in it was that this game was famous for it's innovations ( gravity, facescans and voice acting to hollywood levels, inmersive sci fi plot ) than just for beign a good shooter. My observation were close but the one thing that suprised me was the puzzle/levels/obstacle designs, it's no Tomb Raider ( I dont think it was trying to be ) but considering it had to maintain a level of consistency ( running away in sewers, inside buildings, destroyed urban areas ) they were able to turn areas that didn't look like much into nice little plataform puzzle type sections and did it frequently enough that it breaks away from beign just heavy shooter. 

If it wasn't for level design and the variety of enemies attacks i'd consider this game slightly Overrated, But when you consider how difficult it is even for todays games with higher budgets to do great level design, great graphics ( for it's time but pretty enough for now ), including a branching story and be challenging and I can confirm now that HL2 and it's sequels are the real deal. 

So basically it is a really good game, great even and althou I wouldn't name my first born Freeman like some would, and my top favorite game list still unchanged ( witcher 3, Mass Effect 2, Last of us, Final Fantasy 6 and 7, dishonored 2) I would say to anyone that it's worth giving it a shot if you havn't at this point played it.
